questions.questionText: The Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) has its own AC generator which:
options: A. is driven at constant speed through a Constant Speed Drive (CSD), in the same way as the main AC generator
B. is excited by its Generator Control Unit (GCU) as soon as the APU starts up
C. supplies the aircraft with three-phase 115-200 V, 400 Hz AC.
D. must have the same characteristics as the main AC generator so that it can be easily coupled with the latter

questions.questionText: Which statement with respect to the speed of sound is correct?
options: A. Is independent of altitude
B. Varies with the square root of the absolute temperature.
C. Doubles if the temperature increases from 9° to 36° Centigrade.
D. Increases always if the density of the air decreases

questions.questionText: The speed of sound is affected by the:
options: A. humidity of the air.
B. pressure of the air
C. temperature of the air.
D. density of the air

questions.questionText: When air has passed through a shock wave the speed of sound is
options: A. increased.
B. decreased and beyond a certain Mach number start increasing again
C. not affected
D. decreased.

questions.questionText: When the air is passing through an expansion wave the local speed of sound will
options: A. stay constant
B. increase.
C. decrease and beyond a certain Mach number start increasing again.
D. decrease.

questions.questionText: The aerodynamic centre of the wing is the point, where:
options: A. change of lift due to variation of angle of attack is constant
B. the aeroplane's lateral axis intersects with the centre of gravity
C. pitching moment coefficient does not vary with angle of attack
D. aerodynamic forces are constant

questions.questionText: What effect does the deployment of trailing edge flaps have on the intensity of wingtip vortices?
options: A. Decrease.
B. Increase.
C. Decrease or increase depending on airspeed.
D. Decrease or increase depending on aircraft weight.

questions.questionText: Krueger flaps are [compared to] leading edge droop?
options: A. Less.
B. More.
C. No more nor less.
D. More or less depending on angle of attack.
A. Increase camber and angle of incidence.
B. Decrease camber and angle of incidence.
C. Increase camber and decrease angle of incidence.
D. Decrease camber and increase angle of incidence.

questions.questionText: If stalling speed in straight and level flight is 100 Kts what will it be in a 30 degree banked level turn?
options: A. 97 Kts.
B. 107 Kts.
C. 117 Kts.
D. 127 Kts.
A. Stalling IAS in take-off configuration.
B. Stalling EAS in landing configuration.
C. Stalling TAS in take-off configuration.
D. Stalling CAS in landing configuration.

questions.questionText: What is the pitching moment generated by a cambered wing about its aerodynamic centre in flight?
options: A. Always nose up and of constant magnitude.
B. Always nose down and of varying magnitude with angle of attack.
C. Nose up or nose down depending on angle of attack.
D. Always nose down at its zero lift value.

questions.questionText: What effect does an increase in angle of attack have on the distance between the aerodynamic centre and centre of pressure of a wing in flight?
options: A. The distance remains constant.
B. The distance becomes greater.
C. The distance becomes smaller.
D. The distance becomes smaller up to the stall then becomes greater.
A. Improve lateral and directional stability.
B. Reduce lateral and directional stability.
C. Do not significantly affect lateral and directional stability.
D. Improve roll rates.

questions.questionText: A coarse blade angle is [___] compared to a fine pitch angle?
options: A. More efficient at low TAS.
B. More efficient at high TAS.
C. More efficient at low RPM
D. Less efficient at high FWM.

questions.questionText: Maximum propulsive efficiency of a coarse pitch propeller is [___] compared to a fine pitch propeller.
options: A. Higher.
B. Lower.
C. Identical.
D. Higher or lower depending on RPM.
A. C of G aft of the hinge line and cyclic bending of wings.
B. C of G aft of C of P and cyclic twisting of wings.
C. C of P fwd of torsional axis and cyclic twisting of wings.
D. None of the above.

questions.questionText: Swept back wings are [___] to divergence?
options: A. More prone.
B. Less prone.
C. Never prone.
D. None of the above.
